intro: Cleiemera cuspidata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed cleiemera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow with five petals and are followed by small, oval fruits. Cleiemera cuspidata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
